no_more_50_words: Universities commonly offer a "communications" major, and because students need to take relevant classes to complete their major, many classes on the subject take place at universities.
50_to_100_words: Billy is likely taking his classes at a university because communications is a subject that is typically studied at the post-secondary level. Universities offer degree programs in communications, which often include coursework in areas such as media studies, journalism, and public relations. A university education in communications can prepare students for a wide range of careers in the field, including in media production, advertising, and public relations. Additionally, Universities also provide a variety of extracurricular activities and facilities like labs, libraries, which can provide an environment that support and enhance the learning experience.
